node.title: 'Misadventure' to blame for missing NSW toddler AJ Elfalak's three-day ordeal
node.description: The disappearance of a toddler from a property in the NSW Hunter Valley earlier this year, that sparked a massive land and air search,Â is confirmed as a case of misadventure.
node.content: ["An investigation into the disappearance of a toddler from a property in the New South Wales Hunter Valley has confirmed it to be a case of misadventure.", "Thee-year-old \"AJ\"\u00a0Elfalak, who has autism and is non-verbal, was found in rugged bush\u00a0three days after vanishing from the family's 650-acre property at Putty near Singleton in September.", "The event sparked a large-scale air and land search of the property, with emergency crews at times battling rain and cold temperatures.", "AJ was finally spotted by a NSW Police helicopter drinking water from a puddle in a creek bed on the morning of Monday, September 6.", "The day he was found, Commander of the Hunter Valley Police District, Superintendent Tracy Chapman, said police would continue to look into the circumstances surrounding his disappearance.", "Speculation about the case, including conspiracy theories, circulated in the days and weeks following AJ's discovery.", "But today a NSW Police statement dismissed foul play as a factor.", "\"The incident has been determined to be as a result of misadventure,\" it read.", "This morning, Superintendent Chapman said\u00a0investigators were satisfied AJ had wandered away from his home and become lost.", "She said the family had been helpful and cooperative throughout the investigation."]
